perturbation.original_text: 1.16. PaperExchange Competitor shall mean any exchange, auction or reverse auction for the sale, purchase and/or exchange of pulp, paper and paper packaging.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.16. PaperExchange Competitor shall mean any retail store selling office supplies.
perturbation.explanation: This modifies the definition of 'PaperExchange Competitor' to include a completely unrelated entity, while Section 2.2 continues to restrict VerticalNet from providing content to sites co-branded with the original definition of a 'PaperExchange Competitor'. This creates a contradiction making enforcement uncertain, as a retail office supply store would likely not be considered a competitor in the context of pulp and paper sales.

perturbation.original_text: 4.1.1. During the Term, VerticalNet shall have the exclusive right to arrange for the sale of ***** of the third party advertising inventory (which shall consist of a minimum of one advertisement per page on each of the "Co-Branded Equipment," "Co-Branded Careers," "Resources" and "Home Page" sections or successor, replacement or substitute sections) of the PaperExchange Site and shall be consistent with the amount of advertising on other business to business vertical sites on the PaperExchange Site (the "Third Party Advertising Allocation"). PaperExchange shall retain the right to place advertisements for its own account on the remaining ***** of the Third Party Advertising Allocation; provided, however, that if any portion of such Third Party Advertising Allocation remains unsold 45 days after it becomes available for advertising, VerticalNet shall have the exclusive right to arrange for third party advertising on such unsold Third Party Advertising Allocation.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.1.1. During the Term, VerticalNet shall have the exclusive right to arrange for the sale of advertising on the PaperExchange Site. PaperExchange shall also have the right to place advertisements for its own account on the PaperExchange Site.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific details about the 'Third Party Advertising Allocation', and the percentages associated with it, the modified clause gives both parties a general right to sell advertising, eliminating the defined structure and creating a contradiction. Later sections reference this allocation, which no longer exists, creating enforcement uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: 7.4. Revenue Sharing. After PaperExchange has generated PaperExchange Revenue equal to *****, PaperExchange shall pay an amount equal to ***** of the PaperExchange Revenue to VerticalNet; provided, however, that if, in any given calendar year, VerticalNet receives ***** pursuant to this Section 7.4  [Revenue Sharing], the percentage of PaperExchange Revenue that PaperExchange shall pay to VerticalNet for the remainder of such calendar year shall be reduced to *****; and provided further, however, that if, in any given calendar year, VerticalNet receives ***** in the aggregate pursuant to this Section 7.4  [Revenue Sharing], the percentage of PaperExchange Revenue that PaperExchange shall pay to VerticalNet for the remainder of such calendar year shall be reduced to *****.
perturbation.changed_text: 7.4. Revenue Sharing. After PaperExchange has generated PaperExchange Revenue, PaperExchange shall pay an amount to VerticalNet. The amount and schedule of such payments shall be determined at PaperExchange's sole discretion.
perturbation.explanation: By replacing the specific percentages and thresholds in the revenue-sharing agreement with a clause stating the amount is determined by PaperExchange, creates a contradiction with the spirit of a revenue-sharing agreement and makes the entire section unenforceable. Other sections referencing revenue calculations and auditing are now ambiguous.
